page.title: 20Outdoor Recreation
page.content: The harbour and the foreshore are heavily exploited for recreational purposes.Sailboard and dinghy enthusiasts from clubs on Christchurch and Mudeford Quays engage in both competitive and casual sailing with Christchurch having its own local dinghy design,the Christchurch Scow. Christchurch Harbour Ornithological Group and Friends of Stanpit Marsh use the Marsh Nature Reserve.Stanpit Recreation Ground is used for amateur football matches and by model aircraft clubs.Saltwater anglers use shore and boat.As a premier sea trout and salmon estuary the Avon attracts both commercial and recreational fishing -confluence of Avon and Stour (Claypool)a favourite point. Wildfowling is permitted for authorised guns through Winter from points below foreshore highwater mark.
